known_issues.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Formula
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator in payroll settings intentionally overrides the leave policy formula for unpaid leave. Greyed-out formulas in leave policy indicate this override is active.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Lack of clear visual communication about formula override mechanisms
known_issues.gap_statement: No synchronized mechanism for daily wage formula configuration between leave policy and payroll modules

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were calculated based on previous salary configuration instead of current one.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in dynamic salary configuration handling for leave deduction calculations | Lack of transparent explanation for complex payroll calculation methods

known_issues.title: End of Service Gratuity Leap Year Miscalculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system incorrectly calculates service days by using 365 days instead of 366 days for leap years, resulting in inaccurate gratuity calculations.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's gratuity calculation logic does not automatically adjust for leap years, causing potential underpayment of employee benefits.
known_issues.gap_statement: The EOS gratuity calculator requires enhancement to dynamically handle leap year calculations and incorporate 366-day years in service period computations.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Pro-Rated End of Service Amount Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: End of Service (EOS) calculation is producing incorrect pro-rated amounts due to a rounding or decimal precision error. When calculating pro-rated EOS amounts, the system consistently shows amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's daily wage calculation has a decimal precision limitation that causes systematic undercalculation of pro-rated amounts.
known_issues.gap_statement: Potential product gap in financial calculation precision, specifically in pro-rated salary computations.
known_issues.verifiability_notes: Can verify calculation discrepancy in EOS settlement screen
steps: Navigate to employee EOS settlement
Select departure date
Verify calculated pro-rated amount
expected: Calculated amount matches expected pro-rated salary
No decimal precision errors present

known_issues.title: Leap Year Day Handling in Service Duration
known_issues.issue_explanation: System potentially miscalculates service duration by not consistently accounting for February 29th in leap years, causing minor gratuity calculation discrepancies
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leap year day inclusion in service duration calculation is not transparently handled
known_issues.gap_statement: Need clear documentation on how leap year days are counted in service duration calculations
known_issues.verifiability_notes: Requires precise date range testing across leap year boundaries

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Day Count Mismatch
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates service duration differently from manual calculations, specifically in handling partial years above 5 years of service and leap year day counting
known_issues.limitation_statement: Gratuity calculation logic is complex and not transparently communicated
known_issues.gap_statement: Need more detailed user-friendly explanation of gratuity calculation logic with worked examples
known_issues.verifiability_notes: Calculation logic requires complex mathematical verification

known_issues.title: Days Worked Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: Platform calculates 623 days instead of 622 days when computing gratuity, adding an extra day to service duration calculation
known_issues.limitation_statement: Minor discrepancy in days worked calculation during gratuity computation
known_issues.gap_statement: Potential precision issue in days worked aggregation

known_issues.title: Inconsistent Daily Wage Divisor in Leave Salary Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates leave salary using a fixed daily rate divisor that may not match user expectations about calendar days, potentially causing salary calculation differences
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary calculation follows rigid policy configuration that might not flexibly adapt to varying month lengths
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation about how leave salary calculations are performed, including daily rate divisor configurations

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Accrual Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: Daily wage calculator configured with 'working days' setting causes monthly variations in leave salary accrual calculations, resulting in inconsistent cumulative totals across months
known_issues.limitation_statement: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations
known_issues.gap_statement: Platform lacks a straightforward way to maintain consistent daily wage calculations across months

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Proration Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations with different divisors (30 vs 30.42 days), causing calculation discrepancies.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary and salary proration use separate daily wage formulas that cannot be automatically aligned without manual configuration.
known_issues.gap_statement: No unified daily wage calculation method exists across leave salary and salary proration scenarios.

known_issues.title: Salary Proration Calculation Confusion
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates working days based on work week configuration, which can result in full month (31 days) calculation if all days are marked as working days
known_issues.limitation_statement: Proration depends entirely on work week configuration

known_issues.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
known_issues.issue_explanation: Payroll system fails to prorate salary when employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing date. System correctly prorates for past departure dates but not for future dates.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculator lacks robust date-sensitive proration logic for employees with future departure dates
known_issues.gap_statement: Product lacks dynamic proration handling for varied payroll processing scenarios
known_issues.verifiability_notes: Can verify proration calculation in payroll table
steps: Navigate to employee profile
Check payroll cycle with future departure date
expected: Salary should be prorated based on exact departure date
Full monthly salary should not be displayed

known_issues.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions After Leave Request Modification
known_issues.issue_explanation: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks robust synchronization logic between leave management and payroll deduction systems.
known_issues.gap_statement: No automatic cleanup of orphaned or duplicate deductions when leave requests are modified or deleted.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Incorrect Due to Public Holiday Timing
known_issues.issue_explanation: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes inconsistent between HR and Payroll modules, resulting in incorrect salary deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks real-time synchronization between Time Off and Payroll modules, preventing automatic recalculation when public holidays are added after leave requests.
known_issues.gap_statement: Module communication enhancement needed to ensure accurate working days calculation and consistent salary deduction across system configurations.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Daily Rate Display in February Remarks
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system displays incorrect daily rate in remarks for February, showing 925.81 (based on 31 days) instead of 989.66 (based on 29 days), even though the actual deduction calculation is mathematically correct.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for a dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate calculations and remarks based on the actual number of days in each month.

known_issues.title: Global Daily Rate Configuration Overrides Policy Settings
known_issues.issue_explanation: System applies a global daily rate configuration that supersedes individual leave policy calculation methods, potentially causing incorrect salary deductions
known_issues.limitation_statement: Global configuration prevents policy-level customization of unpaid leave calculations
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent configuration hierarchy and user controls for leave deduction calculations
known_issues.verifiability_notes: Configuration override not directly visible in UI

known_issues.title: Incorrect Daily Rate Month Display
known_issues.issue_explanation: System shows daily rate from payroll processing month instead of leave occurrence month, causing user confusion
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily rate recalculated based on payroll month, not stored from leave occurrence month
known_issues.gap_statement: Need consistent daily rate display mechanism preserving initially calculated rate
